qas.question: The superior colliculus is related to what sensual control of vertebrates?
The larger part of the cerebellum in mammals is called what?
The Neocerebellum supports what other part of the brain?

context: The elaboration of the cerebral cortex carries with it changes to other brain areas. The superior colliculus, which plays a major role in <a0_0>visual<a0_0/> control of behavior in most vertebrates, shrinks to a small size in mammals, and many of its functions are taken over by visual areas of the cerebral cortex. The cerebellum of mammals contains a large portion <a1_0>(the neocerebellum<a1_0/>) dedicated to supporting the <a2_0>cerebral cortex<a2_0/>, which has no counterpart in other vertebrates.
